title: How exactly did the Spanish conquistadors win battles in the Americas while being heavily outnumbered? - Quora

response.answer_text: They recruited as allies native enemies of the empires that they wanted to conquer. They took ruthless advantage of native hospitality and superstition, and of their own superior technology, for instance war dogs, horses, Iron armor and weapons, and explosives such as muskets and cannon that the natives had never seen and did not initially know how to counter. It was no doubt in fact and at the time far more complicated than that, but it may serve as a very rough sketch of what took place.
